data.question: What are the two types of porphyrin MOFs synthesized in the study?
What is the main difference in structure between PMOF-1 and PMOF-2?
data.answer: PMOF-1 has a bilayer structure, while PMOF-2 has a 3D pillar-layered framework.

data.question: Which MOF showed a higher nonlinear absorption coefficient, PMOF-1 or PMOF-2?
Is the 3D pillar-layered framework of PMOF-2 more conducive to interlayer charge transfer than the two-dimensional bilayer of PMOF-1?
What method was used to measure the third-order nonlinear optical properties of the MOFs?
What was the main finding regarding the influence of dimensions on third-order NLO properties?
data.answer: The 3D pillar-layered framework in PMOF-2 is more conducive to interlayer charge transfer, achieving better third-order NLO performance.

data.question: Did PMOF-1 and PMOF-2 maintain their original frameworks after exfoliation?
What was the role of PDMS in the study?
data.answer: PDMS served as a solid matrix to uniformly disperse MOFs for practical optical limiting application.

data.question: Was the photocurrent response of PMOF-1 similar to that of PMOF-2?
What does the presence of strong hydrogen bond interactions between water and the carboxylic group of TCPP-Zn ligands in PMOF-1 indicate?
data.answer: It indicates the formation of a 3D supramolecular framework through strong hydrogen bond and π–π interactions.

data.question: What was used as the light source for photocurrent measurements?
Did the study find that dimensions have little influence on the band gap of PMOFs?
What was the main purpose of synthesizing PMOF-1 and PMOF-2?
data.answer: To evaluate the influence of dimensions on third-order NLO properties.

data.question: Are PMOFs considered potential materials for optical limiting, optical switches, and mode-locked laser systems?
What was the result of the third-order NLO test for PMOFs in a PDMS matrix?
data.answer: PMOF-2 displayed a higher nonlinear absorption coefficient, large third-order susceptibility, and lower limiting threshold than PMOF-1/PDMS.

data.question: What is the significance of the π–π interaction between porphyrin rings in PMOF-1?
data.answer: It contributes to the formation of a 3D supramolecular framework.

data.question: Did the study demonstrate that PMOF-2 has better optical limiting performance than PMOF-1?
What was the role of the BIE ligand in the structure of PMOFs?
data.answer: BIE ligands linked the layers to form a bilayer in PMOF-1 and a 3D pillar-layered framework in PMOF-2.

data.question: Is the thermal stability of PMOF-1 and PMOF-2 up to 450 °C?
What does the formation of a three-dimensional columnar structure in PMOF-2 contribute to?
data.answer: It contributes to a better third-order nonlinear performance due to more conducive interlayer charge transfer.
